result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J Biederman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--Statutory Costs
--DNA Surcharge

**Per 5-2-2016 Order - JOC amended to add attorney fees in the amount of $77. Attorney fees cover cases 15CM419, 15CM465, 15CM489, 15CM491, 16CM13 & 15CT359. Assessment is added to 15CT359**

--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with recommended treatment, per Agent
--Absolute sobriety (no alcohol, no controlled substances w/o a valid prescription, take all prescription drugs as prescribed)
--Random drug and/alcohol screens
--Sobrietor for at least the first 2 months of supervision
--No acts/threats of violence towards any person
--Any other assessment, treatment or counseling per Agent
--Attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program, per Agent

Arresting Agency: Lake Mills PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

****PER 3-14-16 ORDER - IT IS ORDERED that the Judgments of Conviction be amended from "Sobrietor for at least the first 2 months of supervision" to state 'Sobrietor, or other similar means to monitor for alcohol consumption, for at least the first two months of supervision. *****

Criminal Case Settlement

Cases 16CM13, 15CM419, 15CM465, 15CM489, 15CM491 & 15CT359 called together at 11:40 am [Clerk SH] (Misdemeanor Cases were scheduled for MH/FSSC)
Defendant Daniel J Biederman in court, in-custody, with Attorney Sylvie Helena Dahnert. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim Rights Compliance Verified: No request to be heard; Court so finds
16CM13: Service of the Complaint Admitted; Reading Waived

15CT359:
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2

On Count #1, the Court sentences the Defendant: 
--To serve 90 days in the Jefferson County Jail, withOUT Huber/work release privileges; to commence consecutive to any other sentence in being
--Days credit for time already served: 22 days
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process
--To pay fine of $350 + costs = $1379 + $56.74 blood testing fees (Lake Mills PD) = $1635.74; due in $30 increments per month beginning 4/26/16 no later than 4:00 pm and on the 26th day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment will result in 33 days in jail with Huber privileges, consecutive
--Revocation of drivers license for 18 months
--County alcohol/drug assessment ordered
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device requirement/restrictions for: 18 months
--6 demerit points assessed

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered to Counts #1 in Cases 15CM465, 15CM489 & 15CM491; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case 15CM419 & 16CM13


On Counts #1 in Cases 15CM465, 15CM489 & 15CM491, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, each count, concurrent, with all conditions described in the criminal case settlement. which include:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with recommended treatment, per Agent
--Absolute sobriety (no alcohol, no controlled substances w/o a valid prescription, take all prescription drugs as prescribed)
--Random drug and/alcohol screens
--Sobrietor for at least the first 2 months of supervision
--No acts/threats of violence towards any person
--Any other assessment, treatment or counseling per Agent
--Attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program, per Agent
--Costs
--DNA Sample and Surcharge (15CM465)
--Other costs/fees
Court further orders the Sheriff to take DNA Sample; Clerk provides form

Cases 15CM419, 15CM465, 15CM489, 15CM491, and 15CT359 called together at 9:02am [mo]
Defendant Daniel J Biederman in court with attorney Sylvie Dahnert.   DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance
 
The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County Assistant District Attorney, ADA Wambach did prosecute Mr. Biederman. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

As to Cases 15CM419, 15CM465, 15CM489, 15CM491(Initial Appearance occurs):
  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaints admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in all the Criminal Complaint. 
Pleas of "not guilty" entered on all Cases;

State's Motion for Bond Modification on Case 15CT359:
--Request for Adjournment of Motion Hearing by Atty. Dahnert
recess: 9:17am--reconvene:9:36am (to allow review of the Motion for Bond Modification)
--Arguments given by Atty. Dahnert
--The Court grants the State's Motion for Bond Modification of Case 15CT359; gives basis

Atty. Dahnert demands a speedy trial in each case. 
The Court orders that a single $1000 CASH bond, with the non-monetary conditions of case 15CT359 cover, cases 15CM419, 15CM465, 15CM489, 15CM491, and 15CT359.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling; parties agree all trials are one day settings
